data.title: Truman State University
data.meta_description: Discover undergraduate, graduate, and pre-professional programs designed to promote academic exploration and intellectual engagement.
data.text:
Accountancy (on-campus or online)

Master's Degree (MAc)

Ace the CPA exam with the help of one of the nation's top accounting programs.

Accounting

Undergraduate Degree (BS)

Learn about financial accounting, business systems, auditing, taxation, and more.

Accounting Minor

Minor

Develop your knowledge of accounting principles, concepts, and applications.

Actuarial Science Minor

Minor

Use mathematical and statistical methods to anticipate future events and take preventive measures.

African and African Diaspora Studies Minor

Minor

Explore the origin and dynamic cultural mix that constitutes the African Diaspora.

Agricultural Business Minor

Minor

Develop an understanding of livestock and grain commodities and the economics of agriculture.

Agricultural Science

Undergraduate Degree (BS)

Experience a holistic approach to the study of food and fiber production.

Agricultural Studies Minor

Minor

Study how agriculture and the environment have a daily effect on the life of every person.

Animal Science Minor

Minor

Learn about the management of domestic animals and the role of animals in agricultural systems.

Anthropology Minor

Minor

Examine societies from different angles to gain a better understanding of humanity’s past, present, and future.

Applied Behavior Analysis (online)

Graduate Certificate

Prepare to become a skilled professional trained in the science of behavior analysis.

Applied Linguistics Minor

Minor

Study how people acquire language and how to apply it to the teaching, learning, and use of language.

Applied Linguistics\TESOL

Undergraduate Degree (BA)

Develop an understanding of the complexities of human languages.

Art

Undergraduate Degree (BA)

Tailor this major toward your professional goals by choosing to explore art history or studio art.

Art History Minor

Minor

Gain experience thinking about the broader issues of the interaction between art and society.

Art Studio Minor

Minor

Enhance your practical art skills while majoring in another field.

Art with concentration in: Design

Undergraduate Degree (BFA)

Master creative techniques and gain insights into the role of art and design.

Art with concentration in: Studio Art

Undergraduate Degree (BFA)

Explore ceramics, fibers, painting, photography, printmaking, and sculpture.

Asian and Asian American Studies Minor

Minor

Deepen your understanding of the traditions, culture, and arts of Asia.

Astronomy Minor

Minor

Study celestial objects such as moons, planets, stars, nebulae, and galaxies.

Athletic Training

Master's Degree (MAT)

Train for a career as a board-certified athletic trainer.

Biochemistry and Molecular Biology

Undergraduate Degree (BS)

Discover how chemical processes and molecular mechanisms impact biological systems.

Biology

Undergraduate Degree (BA, BS)

Gain expertise and technical skills in the biological sciences.

Biology Minor

Minor

Enrich your scientific frame of reference through the study of life.

Business Administration

Undergraduate Degree (BA, BS)

Become adept in any area of business: finance, management, marketing, and international business.

Business Administration Minor

Minor

Develop a background in principles and practices covering different facets of business.

Business Analytics

Undergraduate Certificate

Receive experiential training in business intelligence tools.

Cannabis and Natural Medicinals

Undergraduate Degree (BS)

Learn about about the multiple aspects of naturally occurring chemical compounds and their uses as therapeutics in traditional and holistic medicinal practices.

Chemistry

Undergraduate Degree (BS)

Acquire knowledge and skills for creative problem-solving using the areas of chemistry.

Chemistry Minor

Minor

Learn the fundamentals of chemistry through scientific investigation and lab experience.

Child Studies Minor

Minor

Study the physical, psychological, cognitive, and social development of children.

Chinese Minor

Minor

Develop traditional skills of listening, speaking, reading, and writing Chinese and explore history and traditions.

Classical Studies Minor

Minor

Study various aspects of ancient Greek and Roman languages and cultures.

Classics

Undergraduate Degree (BA)

Explore the languages, literature, history, and cultures of ancient Greece and Rome.

Cognitive Science Minor

Minor

Study the mind and its processes to discover how and why we think the way we do.

Communication

Undergraduate Degree (BA)

Develop expertise in the principles that guide communication, including journalism.

Communication Disorders

Master's Degree (MA)

Train under the direction of expert speech-language pathologists at our on-site speech and hearing clinic.

Communication Disorders

Undergraduate Degree (BA, BS)

Study speech, language, and hearing processes and disorders associated with these processes.

Communication Minor

Minor

Master the ability to craft and deliver persuasive messages.

Computer Science

Undergraduate Degree (BS)

Gain a basic mastery of computer science, the theory of computation, and the design of computational systems.

Computer Science Minor

Minor

Learn the basic foundations of computer science in conjunction with programming and data analysis.

Counseling: Mental Health Counseling(online)

Master's Degree (MA)

Complete curricular and experiential requirements to pursue entry-level licensure or certification.

Counseling:Rehabilitation Counseling(online)

Master's Degree (MA)

Complete curricular and experiential requirements to pursue entry-level licensure or certification.

Counseling:School Counseling(online)

Master's Degree (MA)

Complete curricular and experiential requirements to pursue entry-level licensure or certification.

Creative Writing

Undergraduate Degree (BFA)

Explore genres of writing including fiction, poetry, creative nonfiction, drama, and screenwriting.

Creative Writing Minor

Minor

Improve your writing skills and gain a strong understanding of how writers practice their craft across genres.

Criminal Justice Studies

Undergraduate Degree (BS)

Enter the criminal justice field: law enforcement, criminal law and the courts, corrections, and criminology.

Criminal Justice Studies Minor

Minor

Gain a broad overview of the various components and activities of our justice systems.

Data Science

Undergraduate Degree (BS)

Learn how to uncover solutions hidden in data to drive more informed decision-making.

Data Science (online)

Graduate Certificate

Learn how to manage, analyze, and draw conclusions from large amounts of data.

Data Science 4+1 Program

Other Undergraduate Programs

Data Science 4+1 is an accelerated program for Truman undergraduates to pursue the Master of Science in Data Science and Analytic Storytelling.

Data Science and Analytic Storytelling (online)

Master's Degree (MS)

Combine the problem-solving skills of data science with critical analytic, presentation, and visualization skills.

Data Science Foundations

Undergraduate Certificate

Develop the fundamental knowledge and skills to apply data science principles.

Data Science Minor

Minor

Learn the tools and techniques for extracting meaning from extensive sets of data.

Design (online)

Undergraduate Degree (BFA)

Heighten your creative efforts by taking classes from wherever it’s convenient for you.

Design Minor

Minor

Develop skills in digital literacy, creating graphics, design layout, and content/project management.

Disability Studies Minor

Minor

Examine the interplay between the lived experience of disability and the social construction of disability.

Disability Studies-Applied Behavior Analysis (online)

Master's Degree (MA)

Develop the knowledge and skills to become a caring, competent, and culturally aware practitioner of applied behavior analysis.

Economics

Undergraduate Degree (BA, BS)

Investigate economic forces that shape societies and the mechanisms that drive economic life.

Economics Minor

Minor

Learn about fundamental economic concepts while diversifying your analytical skillset.

Education

Master's Degree (MAE)

Earn a master's degree while simultaneously completing requirements for teacher certification.

Education Minor

Minor

Gain insight into how people learn and how to effectively share information with others.

English

Undergraduate Degree (BA)

Understand the world through literature and language by studying literature from different cultures and times.

English (online)

Master's Degree (MA)

Explore literature, literary studies, composition theory, pedagogy, creative writing, and linguistics.

English Minor

Minor

Engage with a range of fascinating, challenging, and transformative literature.

Entrepreneurship Minor

Minor

Delve into innovation and entrepreneurship and enhance your problem-solving and business skills.

Environmental Science

Undergraduate Degree (BS)

Explore the interaction between natural systems and organisms – including humans.

Environmental Studies Minor

Minor

Learn how to identify, analyze, and influence the complex forces shaping the environment.

Equine Studies Minor

Minor

Learn the scientific and business principles associated with the use and ownership of horses for recreation, companionship, breeding, and sport.

Exercise Science

Undergraduate Degree (BS)

Study human movement and learn how to help people live healthier lives.

Exercise Science/ Master of Athletic Training 3+2 Program

Other Undergraduate Programs

The professional phase of the ES/MAT 3+2 program requires 62 credits of graduate coursework that is completed over the course of two years and requires continuous enrollment. The curriculum is sequenced to allow for the greatest amount of depth in both content and clinical application.

Film Studies Minor

Minor

Learn about the production, distribution, exhibition, history, and theory of film.

Folklore Minor

Minor

Explore how literature, language, dance, history, and fine arts play a role in understanding folklore.

Foreign Language Teacher Preparation Minor

Minor

Take steps toward initial training for teaching languages.

Forensic Science Minor

Minor

Investigate how to gather and analyze information using the scientific method.

French Minor

Minor

Develop your language proficiency and explore French culture.

German Minor

Minor

Learn about German culture and the language to enhance your major.

Gifted Education (online)

Master's Degree (MA)

Learn how to identify gifted characteristics in students, develop effective curricula, and provide support.

Greek Minor

Minor

Experience the language, culture, and history of the ancient Greeks.

Health Science

Undergraduate Degree (BS)

Train to become a promoter of health in educational or clinical settings.

History

Undergraduate Degree (BA, BS)

Study the past to gain a deeper understanding of today's complex world.

History Minor

Minor

Build a foundation in historical processes by exploring the past.

Information Systems Minor

Minor

Learn how system analysis, databases, and internet programming affect organizations.

Interdisciplinary Studies Major

Undergraduate Degree (BA, BS)

Design a unique program of study that matches your specific goals and interests. Popular major emphases within this area include Child Studies, Asian Studies, Environmental Studies, and Neuroscience.

International Studies Minor

Minor

Explore global issues and area studies covering international communities beyond U.S. borders.

Italian Studies Minor

Minor

Acquire an in-depth appreciation for the Italian language, culture, and civilization.

Japanese Minor

Minor

Learn about Japanese culture and the language to enhance your major.

Jazz Studies Minor

Minor

Learn the fundamentals of jazz while unlocking your creative potential.

Latin Minor

Minor

Learn about the fundamentals of Latin and its influence on languages today.

Leadership (on-campus or online)

Master's Degree (MA)

Study leadership theory, decision-making, research, ethics, and organizational change.

Legal Studies Minor

Minor

Expand your understanding of how the legal system operates and how law intersects with almost every aspect of society.

Liberal Studies

Undergraduate Degree (BA, BS)

Build an individualized program of study with a concentration in your chosen area of focus.

Linguistics

Undergraduate Degree (BA, BS)

Learn about human language as it is — not as we think it should be.

Linguistics Minor

Minor

Study how languages interact with other facets of the human experience.

Mathematical Biology Minor

Minor

Acquire expertise in mathematical modeling, statistical analysis, and computing in a biological context.

Mathematics

Undergraduate Degree (BA, BS)

Learn to apply the latest mathematical theories across multiple disciplines from game theory to probability to finance.

Mathematics Minor

Minor

Strengthen your ability to communicate mathematical information by learning different techniques and approaches to math problems.

Medieval and Early Modern Studies Minor

Minor

Better understand the world today by exploring the ways it has developed from its medieval roots.

Military Science Minor

Minor

Acquire management and analytical skills essential to being an adaptive leader.

Modern Language: French, German, Spanish

Undergraduate Degree (BA)

Study the language, culture, and literature of the French, German, or Spanish language communities.

Modern Language: specialization in French

Undergraduate Degree (BA)

Major in Modern Language: French and study culture, language, literature, and conversation.

Modern Language: specialization in German

Undergraduate Degree (BA)

Major in Modern Language: German and study culture, language, literature, and conversation.

Modern Language: specialization in Spanish

Undergraduate Degree (BA)

Major in Modern Language: Spanish and study culture, language, literature, and conversation.

Museum Studies Minor

Minor

Learn the basics and approaches to museum interpretation and management.

Music

Master's Degree (MA)

Train one-on-one with internationally recognized composers, conductors, performers, and scholars.

Music Business

Undergraduate Degree (BS)

Whether you’re an aspiring music business professional, entrepreneur, or artist, this major prepares you for success in the music industry.

Music Minor

Minor

Pursue your interest in music, increase your musical knowledge, and enhance your musical skills.

Music Therapy

Undergraduate Degree (BS)

Leverage the power of music to directly improve the lives of others.

Music, Emphasis Groups

Undergraduate Degree (BM)

Pursue the most musically intense offering within the music discipline at Truman.

Music, General

Undergraduate Degree (BA)

Gain substantial training on an instrument or as a singer with broad academic preparation.

Music, Pre-Certification

Undergraduate Degree (BA)

Focus on your passion for music in preparation for a professional teaching degree.

Music: concentration in Liberal Arts

Undergraduate Degree (BA)

Build a broad base you can apply to a wide range of areas in the music industry.

Musical Theatre Minor

Minor

Engage in practical and theoretical experiences in the areas of singing, acting, and dance.

Musicology Minor

Minor

Examine the forms, methods, and functions of music in Western and non-Western cultures.

Nursing

Undergraduate Degree (BSN)

Learn how to provide safe, effective nursing care to patients of all ages in a variety of healthcare settings.

Nursing (Accelerated Program)

Undergraduate Degree (ABSN)

If you have a bachelor's or associate's degree or want to change majors, apply for our Accelerated Bachelor of Science in Nursing program to become a nurse in as few as 15 months.

Philosophy and Religion

Undergraduate Degree (BA, BS)

Recognize and analyze the philosophical and religious beliefs and assumptions grounding human cultural systems.

Philosophy and Religion Minor

Minor

Gain insight into human cultural systems by studying philosophical and religious beliefs and assumptions.

Physics

Undergraduate Degree (BA, BS)

Receive rigorous training in the theories and practice of physics to gain a greater understanding of the universe.

Physics - Dual Degree Program

Other Undergraduate Programs

Earn a Bachelor of Arts in Physics from Truman while getting an engineering degree from another university.

Physics - Pre-Engineering

Other Undergraduate Programs

Spend the first two years of your Bachelor of Engineering degree at Truman.

Physics Minor

Minor

Gain a deeper understanding of the universe and enhance your knowledge of physical realities.

Political Communication Minor

Minor

Gain a background in the theories of communication and political science.

Political Science and International Relations

Undergraduate Degree (BA, BS)

Learn about the practice of government, politics, and international relations.

Political Science and International Relations Minor

Minor

Explore the underlying theories that drive political behavior and international relations.

Pre-Art Therapy Minor

Minor

Prepare for further education in the area of art therapy.

Pre-Athletic Training

Pre-Professional Interest

This concentration area for the exercise science major covers biomechanics, exercise physiology, strength and conditioning, personal training, and more.

Pre-Chiropractic

Pre-Professional Interest

Truman offers coursework to help prepare you to enroll in chiropractic school.

Pre-Dental

Pre-Professional Interest

Truman offers coursework to help prepare you to enroll in dental school.

Pre-Education

Other Undergraduate Programs, Undergraduate Degree

Receive individualized advising to prepare for entrance into the professional program at the graduate level.

Pre-Law

Pre-Professional Interest

No matter what your major is, our pre-law studies ensure you’re well-equipped for law school.

Pre-Medicine

Pre-Professional Interest

Truman provides preparation to help you reach your goal of attending medical school.

Pre-Occupational Therapy

Pre-Professional Interest

Truman provides preparation to help you reach your goal of attending occupational therapy school.

Pre-Optometry

Pre-Professional Interest

Truman provides preparation to help you reach your goal of attending optometry school.

Pre-Pharmacy

Pre-Professional Interest

Truman provides preparation to help you reach your goal of attending pharmacy school.

Pre-Physical Therapy

Pre-Professional Interest

Truman provides preparation to help you reach your goal of attending physical therapy school.

Pre-Physician Assistant

Pre-Professional Interest

Truman provides preparation to help you reach your goal of attending physician assistant school.

Pre-Veterinary

Pre-Professional Interest

Truman provides preparation to help you reach your goal of attending veterinary school.

Psychology

Undergraduate Degree (BA, BS)

Investigate human behavior and mental processes using the scientific method.

Psychology Minor

Minor

Learn about the theories, research techniques, and applications of the scientific study of human behavior.

Public Administration Minor

Minor

Learn the principles of public administration and policy-making.

ROTC

Other Undergraduate Programs

The U.S. Army Reserve Officers’ Training Corps program offers hands-on leadership and management training.

Social Issue Advocacy Major

Undergraduate Degree (BA, BS)

Build a pathway to becoming a general advocate for issues important to you.

Sociology Minor

Minor

Study how the interactions and connections among institutions, organizations, groups, and individuals work together.

Sociology/ Anthropology

Undergraduate Degree (BA, BS)

Explore industrialized societies like the one we live in or smaller-scale societies and long-term patterns of biological and cultural change.

Spanish Minor

Minor

Build your oral and written language skills and develop cultural knowledge and understanding of Spanish.

Spanish Minor for the Professions

Minor

Obtain language proficiency and cultural awareness to assist you in serving the needs of Spanish-speaking individuals.

Statistics

Undergraduate Degree (BA, BS)

Discover hidden patterns by analyzing information and creating models to capture insights that help solve complex problems.

Statistics Minor

Minor

Explore the world of statistics: the study of the collection, analysis, interpretation, presentation, and understanding of data.

STEM Research Minor

Minor

Sharpen your research skills in science, technology, engineering, and math-related fields.

Study Abroad

Other Undergraduate Programs

Broaden your education and explore the world through study abroad programs around the globe.

Theatre

Undergraduate Degree (BA)

Engage in every level of theatre production including performing, designing, directing, writing, technology, and more.

Theatre Minor

Minor

Develop your knowledge of theatre and gain experience in all aspects of performance art.

Undeclared

Undergraduate Degree

Not sure what major is the best fit for you? The Undeclared major is one of the largest majors for Truman’s incoming first-year students.

Web UX-UI Design Minor

Minor

Master the basics of web and visual design.
